    30 June 2020

    latex from code

    by Subhaditya Mukherjee

    I want to talk about how to get these beautiful looking latex equations without any effort at all.

    So we use this really cool package called Latexify and hack it a bit to make it easy for ourselves.

    ]add Latexify
using Latexify

    Since latexify outputs a string, we just need to pass the string of the function we want to it.

    print(latexify("log.(exp.(ŷ)/sum(exp.(ŷ)))"))

    But there are two annoyances

    • It is wayyy too long to type all the time
    • The latex renderer we are using (kmarkdown) needs the output to be in the format with an extra beforeandaftertheexpression,whilethisjustgives“ before and after the expression, while this just gives “beforeandaftertheexpression,whilethisjustgives“ string ”</li><li>Soalittlehack</li></ul><divclass="language−juliahighlighter−rouge"><divclass="highlight"><preclass="highlight"><code><spanclass="k">function</span><spanclass="nf">lat</span><spanclass="x">(</span><spanclass="n">x</span><spanclass="x">)</span><spanclass="n">print</span><spanclass="x">(</span><spanclass="sc">′”</li> <li>So a little hack</li> </ul> <div class="language-julia highlighter-rouge"><div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight"><code><span class="k">function</span><span class="nf"> lat</span><span class="x">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="x">)</span> <span class="n">print</span><span class="x">(</span><span class="sc">'”</li><li>Soalittlehack</li></ul><divclass="language−juliahighlighter−rouge"><divclass="highlight"><preclass="highlight"><code><spanclass="k">function</span><spanclass="nf">lat</span><spanclass="x">(</span><spanclass="n">x</span><spanclass="x">)</span><spanclass="n">print</span><spanclass="x">(</span><spanclass="sc">′') print(latexify(string(x))) print('$') end

    Now we can just do this

    lat("-sum(y .* logsoftmax(ŷ) .* weight) * 1 // size(y, 2)")

    And we get this

    (−sum(y⋅logsoftmax(y^)⋅weight))⋅//(1,size(y,2))\left( - \mathrm{sum}\left( y \cdot \mathrm{logsoftmax}\left( ŷ \right) \cdot weight \right) \right) \cdot \mathrm{//}\left( 1, \mathrm{size}\left( y, 2 \right) \right)(−sum(y⋅logsoftmax(y^​)⋅weight))⋅//(1,size(y,2))

    tags: latex - code - convert
